Entrap.origin: [police him into violating the literal terms of a criminal statute "W. R. LaFave and A. W. Scott, Jr."]

en·trap·ping.definition: to cause (a person) to commit a crime by means of undue persuasion, encouragement, or fraud in order to later prosecute [police him into violating the literal terms of a criminal statute "W. R. LaFave and A. W. Scott, Jr."]
